page.title: 10Agriculture in District
page.content: Most farms have grain drying and storage facilities which are needed partcularly for Wheat and Feeding Barley,but most of the Malting Barley,Oil Seed Rape and Peas leave the farm immediately after the harvest. Following harvest some straw which is not required for fodder or for bedding is burnt on the field,this quick clearance allows an earlier start to be made to Autumn cultivatations. Due to increased arable acreage there has been a reductionin stock numbers.No dairy cows or poultry are kept and there is only one pig farm.Stock kept on the grass include cows for beef production feeding cattle,ewes for lambs and feeding sheep.Hay and silage are con_ served for winter feed supplemented by cereal by products.Most cattle and some sheep are inside during winter.
